{"step_by_step_thinking": "Guiding planes are parallel surfaces in a removable partial denture that provide paths of placement and removal. They do not directly contribute to clasp retention, so option A is incorrect. They also do not transmit forces along the long axis of the tooth, so option C is incorrect. Guiding planes do not guide the key into the key way, so option D is incorrect. However, they do provide increased resistance towards horizontal movement, making the denture more stable.", "answer_choice": "B"}
